Package com.teamx.demo.controller

Class LoginController

java.lang.Object
com.teamx.demo.controller.LoginController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/auth") public class LoginController extends Object
REST controller for authentication and wallet operations.

      Returns all login records.
      Returns:
      list of all users

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> login(@RequestBody LoginModel loginRequest)
      Authenticates a user and returns a JWT token if successful.
      Parameters:
      loginRequest - the login request containing email and password
      Returns:
      JWT token and user info if successful, error otherwise

    • signup

      @PostMapping("/signup") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> signup(@RequestBody LoginModel signupRequest)
      Registers a new user.
      Parameters:
      signupRequest - the signup request containing user details
      Returns:
      JWT token and user info if successful, error otherwise

    • deductFromWallet

      @PostMapping("/deduct") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deductFromWallet(@RequestBody Map<String,Object> payload)
      Deducts an amount from the user's wallet.
      Parameters:
      payload - map containing "email" and "amount"
      Returns:
      updated wallet balance or error

    • addToWallet

      @PostMapping("/wallet/add") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addToWallet(@RequestParam String email, @RequestParam int amount)
      Adds money to the user's wallet.
      Parameters:
      email - the user's email
      amount - the amount to add
      Returns:
      updated wallet balance or error

    • getWalletDetails

      @GetMapping("/wallet") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getWalletDetails(@RequestParam String email)
      Gets wallet details for a user.
      Parameters:
      email - the user's email
      Returns:
      wallet balance or error

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/delete") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteUser(@RequestParam String email)
      Deletes a user by email.
      Parameters:
      email - the user's email
      Returns:
      success or error message
